  • people 亻 who are happy 幸: fortunate or lucky

Ru_Notes: Фонетик и аналог: 幸 (さいわい、さち、しあわせ、コウ счастье, удача).
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 化 (превращаться), 十 (десять), 立 (стоять), 辛 (острый на вкус)
Ru_trainchinese: xìng: (графема) к счастью, по счастливому совпадению; питать благосклонность к
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) by happiness (幸) has happiness
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " people " and " lucky ", it means luck. "Han Feizi·Cunning Envoy": "Today the people who keep the duty and measure want to go up with the loyal to the infant, but are not seen, and the clever words and the treacherous ways in order to steal the world fortunately." Chen Qiyou's collection: "It means stealing by luck." Deceive the world."

" Fortunate " can mean family happiness and love. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Huang Xiang Biography": "The reigns are recommended by many, and the favor is very popular, and the debaters ridiculed him."

" Xing " also refers to those who are loved by the emperor's relatives. "Huan Di Ji Zan": "Five fortunate political transfer, three prisons for punishment and prostitution." Li Xian's note: "Fortunately, Cheng Ye."

" Fortunately " also refers to disregarding appearance. Song Su Shunqin "Answer to Du Gongshu": "It is a pity that the sun and the moon, fame and fame are easy, although it is difficult to retreat, it is not easy to retreat. Although I can be fortunately led away today, there is no remedy for the time, it is enough to be a good thing!"

" Fortunately " also means wishing to obtain undivided property or fame and fortune. Qing Weiyuan's "Sixteenth of the Book of Silent Thoughts": "Fortunately for others, those who do harm, those who live for the merits of others will lose, and those who do not have the truth will enjoy the obvious.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " people " and " lucky ", it means luck.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，「幸」聲，表示僥倖。《韓非子‧詭使》：「今守度奉量之士欲以忠嬰上而不得見，巧言利辭行姦軌以倖偷世者數御。」陳奇猷集解：「謂以僥倖而偷欺於世也。」

　　「倖」可表示親幸、寵愛。《後漢書‧黃香傳》：「在位多所薦達，寵遇甚盛，議者譏其過倖。」

　　「倖」也指受帝王親幸寵愛的佞人。《後漢書‧桓帝紀贊》：「政移五倖，刑淫三獄。」李賢注：「倖，佞也。」

　　「倖」還指不顧而去貌。宋蘇舜欽〈答杜公書〉：「日月可惜，功名易隳，處雖為難，退亦未易。今雖能倖然引去，無補於時，亦安足以為嘉事！」

　　「倖」還表示希圖得到非分的財物或功名利祿等。清魏源《默觚下‧治篇十六》：「倖人之有者害，居人之功者敗，無實而享顯者殆。」

倖字的基本解释

倖
xìng
同“幸”⑤。

倖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xìng］
［《廣韻》胡耿切，上耿，匣。］
(1)希图得到非分的财物或功名利禄等。
(2)侥幸，因偶然的机会获得成功。
(3)亲幸；宠爱。
(4)指受帝王亲幸宠爱的佞人。
(5)旧指男子的情爱。
(6)牵系。
(7)不顾而去貌。
(8)庆幸，引以为乐。参见“倖災樂禍”。

倖字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　倖； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页107第31
【廣韻】胡耿切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】下耿切，?音幸。徼倖。佞倖。　又叶虛陵切，音興。【班固·奕旨】博縣於投，不專在行。優者有不遇，劣者有僥倖。踦挐相凌，氣勢力爭。雖有雌雄，未足以爲平也。◎按倖，韻書皆讀上聲。惟《正字通》臆增去聲，今不从。

倖字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
倖字的起名意思

宠爱。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xìng］
["Guangyun" Hu Gengqie, Shang Geng, Xia. ]
(1) Hope to obtain undivided property or fame and fortune.
(2) Luckily, it succeeded by chance.
(3) Fortunately, beloved.
(4) Refers to the renegade who is favored and loved by the emperor's relatives.
(5) Old refers to the love of men.
(6) Linkage.
(7) Disregarding appearance.
(8) Fortunately, happy. See "glorious misfortune".
